ygData.subject: Re: New Subject-Jewelry
ygData.msgSnippet: My best spot is PAW, Giant Snake fangs fetch a pretty penny, but the time between PAW and a place to sel renders it not worthy of the time. And that is Solo as
ygData.messageBody:
My best spot is PAW, Giant Snake fangs fetch a pretty penny, but the time
between PAW and a place to sel renders it not worthy of the time. And that
is Solo as agroup, the snakeskin catches a good value, but it's rare, and in
agroup you will prolly only get piece on your trip.

-Dyce

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Rodney Miller [SMTP:RMiller@...]
> Sent: Monday, May 10, 1999 11:26 AM
> To: 'eqpaladin@onelist.com'
> Subject: Re: [eqpaladin] New Subject-Jewelry
>
> From: Rodney Miller <RMiller@...>
>
> The dervish cutthroats make for some good cash. If you are over level 10
> or
> so, and have good group, you can tear into the Derv's near Freeport. I
> have
> made as much as 25 platinum in one night there. They have dervish
> cutthroat
> rings and sometimes have jewels and bronze weapons. That is the most
> profitable place I've found so far. Does anyone else have more input?
>
> Grod
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Chris Ferriera [mailto:cferriera@...]
> Sent: Monday, May 10, 1999 10:08 AM
> To: 'eqpaladin@onelist.com'
> Subject: Re: [eqpaladin] New Subject-Jewelry
>
>
> From: Chris Ferriera <cferriera@...>
>
> Ok,
>
> Now that I know, I still cant afford it. Wheres a good cash earning
> spot. I did good in Runnyeye, and now Im in PAW. Is there something im
> missin here on the topic of the the Big Payoff?
>
> -Dyce
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Rodney Miller [SMTP:RMiller@...]
> > Sent: Monday, May 10, 1999 11:13 AM
> > To: 'eqpaladin@onelist.com'
> > Subject: Re: [eqpaladin] New Subject-Jewelry
> >
> > From: Rodney Miller <RMiller@...>
> >
> > This has been a hot topic for me since I have been doing a lot of
> > purchasing
> > the last week. I have even considered working on my smithing skills.
> The
> > going rates for items I can remember are as follows:
> >
> > Banded Tunic 40pp
> > Cape 35pp
> > Boots 14 pp (i think)
> > Leggings 20 pp
> >
> > Those are the ones that I remember. This is on the Innoruuk server.
> Our
> > smiths have mostly fixed the prices, so the prices on other servers may
> be
> > lower or higher depending on your market. However, if you check chain
> > mail
> > prices, it is still cheaper than chain and stronger, so it is a good
> deal.
> >
> > Grod
> > Innoruuk
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Chris Ferriera [mailto:cferriera@...]
> > Sent: Monday, May 10, 1999 10:02 AM
> > To: 'eqpaladin@onelist.com'
> > Subject: Re: [eqpaladin] New Subject-Jewelry
> >
> >
> > From: Chris Ferriera <cferriera@...>
> >
> > Hi, this is off the topic of Jewelry, but what should a reasonable
> person
> > expect to pay for various items of banded armor?
> >
> > -Dycedarg
> >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: Rodney Miller [SMTP:RMiller@...]
> > > Sent: Monday, May 10, 1999 11:01 AM
> > > To: 'eqpaladin@onelist.com'
> > > Subject: Re: [eqpaladin] New Subject-Jewelry
> > >
> > > From: Rodney Miller <RMiller@...>
> > >
> > > Here is a subject we haven't touch on and one I have been wondering
> > about.
> > > I am level 15 and have pretty much got a full set of banded armor.
> > > However,
> > > I don't have any earrings, and the rings I wear are just Dervish
> > Cutthroat
> > > rings which add to your dexterity. What kind of jewelry is everyone
> > > wearing
> > > and what magic effects do they have? In addition, can you buy this
> > > jewelry
> > > at the shops or do you have to kill certain characters to get it?
> > >
> > > Grod
